{{Infobox figure skater |name= Jennifer Don |image= jennifer Don.jpg |caption=Jennifer Don in 2004 |country= [[Chinese Taipei]]
[[United States]] |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1984|10|6}} |residence= |height= {{convert|1.55|m|ftin|0|abbr=on}} |coach= [[Tiffany Chin]] |choreographer=[[Mary Scotvold]], [[Paul Wylie]] |skating club= Texas Gulf Coast |retired= |combined total= 149.38 |combined date= 2004 [[Cup of Russia]] |SP score= 55.58 |SP date= 2004 Cup of Russia |FS score= 93.80 |FS date= 2004 Cup of Russia }} '''Jennifer Don''' åæç (born October 6, 1984) is a [[Taiwanese American]] [[Figure skating|figure skater]] who competed in both the [[pair skating|pairs]] and [[singles skating|singles]] disciplines. Before representing [[Chinese Taipei]] in 2006, she represented the United States in international competitions. She won the Nebelhorn Trophy competing for the U.S., earning her place in skating history by becoming the first woman to win a competition under the ISU International Judging System. == Personal background == Don was born on October 6, 1984 in [[Houston, Texas]].{{cite web|title=Jennifer Don Biography|url=http://www.isuresults.com/bios/isufs00005971.htm|work=International Skating Union|publisher=International Skating Union|accessdate=20 July 2011}} She graduated from the [[University of California, Los Angeles]] (UCLA) in 2009, where she earned a bachelors degree in [[Global Studies]].{{cite web|last=Elfman|first=Lois|title=Jennifer Don Stays Connected|url=http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20091231&content_id=7864216&vkey=ice_news|work=icenetwork.com|publisher=icenetwork.com|accessdate=20 July 2011}} == Skating background == Don started skating at the age of 10.{{cite web|title=Jennifer Don|url=http://www.unseenskaters.com/biography/donjennifer.html|work=Unseen Skaters|publisher=Unseen Skaters|accessdate=20 July 2011}} As a [[pair skating|pair skater]], Don won the bronze medal with [[Jonathon Hunt]] at the [[2003 World Junior Figure Skating Championships]].{{cite web|last=Mittan|first=Barry|title=Don and Hunt Finish Dream Season with Junior Worlds Bronze|url=http://www.goldenskate.com/2003/03/don-and-hunt-finish-dream-season-with-junior-worlds-bronze/|work=Golden Skate|publisher=Golden Skate|accessdate=20 July 2011}} They announced the end of their partnership on March 2005.{{cite web|title=Jennifer Don and Jonathon Hunt Announce End of Partnership|url=http://www.usfigureskating.org/Story.asp?id=29206&type=news|work=U.S. Figure Skating|accessdate=20 July 2011}} As a singles skater, she was the 2001 United States National Figure Skating Bronze Medalist in Novice Ladies and the 2002 United States Figure Skating Silver Medalist in Junior Ladies.{{cite web|last=Mittan|first=Barry|title=Double Identity for USAâs Jennifer Don|url=http://www.goldenskate.com/2004/08/double-identity-for-usas-jennifer-don/|work=Golden Skate|publisher=Golden Skate|accessdate=20 July 2011}} In 2005, she won the Taiwanese National Championships.{{cite web|title=Chinese Taipei pin medal hope on figure skater Don|url=http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/200701/28/eng20070128_345387.html|work=People's Daily Online|publisher=Xinhua|accessdate=20 July 2011}} ==Results== ===Ladies Singles=== for the United States (excluding Taiwanese Nationals and Winter Universiade) {| class="wikitable" |- !
